channel.description: Recent content in File Systems on Analyst

item.title: File Systems Overview
item.description: Name Partition size (min/max) Cluster size (min/max) File Max Size fstab code FAT16 16Mb/2Gb 2Kb/32Kb FAT32 32 KB (officially), 512 bytes (unofficially)- 2Tb üîç 512b - 32Kb/64Kb (for large volumes) NTFS 1.

item.title: APFS
item.description: APFS APM and APFS seem to be unable to live together. APFS requires GUID. I have come to that conclusion when I tried formating the drive with a APM and then APFS with DiskUtility.

item.title: ExtX
item.description: 2 No journaling 3 Same but + journaling 4 New FS

item.title: FAT
item.description: Any FAT partition has two main parts: system area and data area. System area contains FAT boot record (every file system has a boot record), 1st FAT and 2nd FAT.

item.title: HFS and HFS+
item.description: HFS HFS+ Since 1998, since macOS 8.1. Was replaced by APFS. Didn’t natively support full disk encryption (FV2 was added later).

item.title: NTFS
item.description: Developed in collaboration with IBM. POSIX compliant. Official docs for NTFS here. ‚ùóÔ∏è Everything is a file!

item.title: ReiserFS
item.description: Allows storing multiple files in a single sector. exclamation mark ‚ùóÔ∏èUnique to this FS!

item.title: Flash Memory Overview
item.description: In this article I’m going to give a general overview of how SSD works and how it’s different from an HDD.

item.title: HDD Overview
item.description: In this article I’m going to give a general overview of how HDDs work. Floppy Floppy disks üíæ are like dinosaurs ü¶ï.
